note.p: Career: Apprenticed to an apothecary; employed by the Duke of Richmond and by Lord Petre for garden design; kept an apothecary's shop in James Street, Covent Garden; knew Martin Folkes and Henry Baker; JP for Westminster; kept gardens in Bayswater where he grew plants for use in his own medicines; attacked the Royal Society in satirical pamphlets after being rejected; known as Sir John because he was of the Swedish order of Vasa
Notes: Note on certificate: '17 Novr 1768 Balloted and Rejected. 14 Friends, 82 Against him
